author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to block transferred data based on specific content patterns. This is crucial for preventing the exfiltration of sensitive information and ensuring that data transfers comply with organizational policies and regulations. The capability includes implementing content inspection mechanisms, defining content patterns that trigger blocking actions, and ensuring that these mechanisms are integrated into data transfer processes.

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.
Network monitoring tools and access to network infrastructure for analysis and control.

title: Establish Ability to Block Transferred Data by Content Pattern

references.name: Network Security Controls and Traffic Filtering
NIST SP 800-41 Rev. 1: Guidelines for Firewall and Network Security
